meanings.definition: A mat placed at a doorway for wiping dirt from shoes.
meanings.sent1: The doormats at our house are always clean because we wipe our shoes on them.
meanings.sent2: Please remember to wipe your shoes on the doormats before entering the house.
meanings.sent3: The doormats seemed to whisper 'clean me' every time someone stepped on them.
meanings.sent4: The doormats were like loyal guardians, protecting the floors from dirt and mud.
meanings.sent5: The colorful doormats added a welcoming touch to the entrance of the house.

meanings.definition: A person who is easily taken advantage of or treated poorly by others.
meanings.sent1: She felt like a doormat, always being pushed around by others.
meanings.sent2: He needs to stand up for himself and not let people treat him like a doormat.
meanings.sent3: Being a doormat in that situation was no longer an option for him.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been a doormat for too long and decided to assert herself.
meanings.sent5: He finally stopped being a doormat and started standing up for his rights.
